result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary N Betley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case settlement  filed in 14CF28, WITH ATTACHED VICTIM WITNESS STATEMENT
filed in 14CF28

Defendant Zachary N Betley in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF34, 14CF36.  Court recites case settlements into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
14CF28-DE will enter a plea to amended Ct 1, and Ct 2.  Ct 3 will be dismissed but read in.  Will pay restitution of $29.53 J/S with co-defendant.
14CF34-DE will enter a plea to Ct 2.  Ct's 1 and 3 will be dismissed but read in.  DE will pay restitution of $125.00 J/S with co-defendant.
14CF36-DE will enter a plea to Ct 2.  Ct's 1 and 3 will be dismissed but read in.  DE will pay restitution of $1556.72 J/S with do-defendant.  
DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct's 1(amended) and 2 in 14CF28-  Ct 2 in 14CF34-  Ct 2 in 14CF36 .  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  
Withhold sentence 2 yrs probation, will pay restitution as requested J/S with Hunter Volk, no contact with victims or their property, no contact with co-defendat no alcohol possession or consumption, no illicit drugs without a valid prescription, DE will write a letter of apology to victims, letter will be first approved by DA's office, will be eligible for expunction upon successful completion of all cases.  DE will pay CC. The court will accept the recommendations of the parties.
